article.description: St. John's beats Xavier twice in 10 days, 58-57
article.headline: St. John's beats Xavier twice in 10 days, 58-57
article.linkText: St. John's beats Xavier twice in 10 days, 58-57
article.story: NEW YORK -- D'Angelo Harrison scored 20 points, Sir'Dominic Pointer added 19 and St. John's beat Xavier 58-57 on Monday for its second win over the Musketeers in 10 days. Pointer's layup in transition gave St. John's a 58-53 lead, but Xavier's Jalen Reynolds answered with a dunk and his block on the Red Storm's next possession led to two free throws by Trevon Bluiett to pull within 58-57 with 25.2 seconds left. Xavier's Remy Abell then picked Harrison's pocket and the Musketeers called timeout to set up their final play. Myles Davis missed a contested jumper and St. John's secured the rebound. St. John's (19-9, 8-7 Big East) sits in fifth place in the conference standings, a half-game ahead of Xavier (18-11, 8-8). Rysheed Jordan added 10 points as St. John's won for the fifth time in its last six games. Bluiett led Xavier with 17 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
